title: Does swain know whats coming ?
body:
Hey all i im really interested in what u lot think about swains motives.
i wouldn't consider this a theory more of a couple shots in the dark or shots in the void ;).

what do u guys think swains over arching motives. i feel it might be far more then just domination.
hear me out cos its somewhat of a long shot.
what if swain knows whats coming, if he knows of the cataclysmic events soon to come what if the demon he controls told him everything that will come.
could he know how threatening the void is after all he knows what the void is with phrases in game of {{champion:38}} and some of the void monsters {{champion:421}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:31}}  and knows how deadly they can be
lets also not forget he could possible see into the far future. after he taunts {{champion:245}} over his limits of time control

What if hes looking for enough power to defeat the void. maybe hes after weapons that could be used to stop the void?

what u lot think im a mega lore junkie and love talking about stuff like this

replies.body: If there's one thing Swain knows, it's to **not let anyone know** just how much he knows. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
does he know why kids love the taste of cinnamon toast crunch?
If he does have such forbidden knowledge... we should truly, truly fear him...
God forbid he know how many licks it takes to get to the center of a Tootsie Pop.

> [{quoted}](name=Interlocutioner,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=jF975c3E,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-09-06T18:46:22.123+0000)
>
> If there's one thing Swain knows, it's to **not let anyone know** just how much he knows. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

He knows that you know that he knows about something you all want to know about.
Is it one of the reasons why he invited LeBlanc to be a member of the Trifarix? Fooling her into believing he doesn't know the full picture and only has partial information?

Swain's bio outright states that he knows about imminent threats: "Gathering knowledge as the demon did before him, Swain has foreseen far greater dangers lurking just beyond." It's why he seeks to unify Valoran (and beyond) and consolidate Noxus' power. He knows people are stronger together than divided. "The monsters of today will be the heroes of tomorrow."

There's two main threats to Runeterra right now: the Black Mist and the Void. Darkin and World Runes are dangerous, but not on the same level.

Swain knows who the Ruined King is, and he's aware that Mordekaiser wants the Immortal Bastion back. He knows about the Watchers and the Void, as well. He's preparing for them, but the question is just how much information he has.
World Runes can destroy the entire world how is the Black Mist more dangerous?

World runes do nothing if you don't interact with them. The Black Mist and the undead act on their own.

Ryze can keep world runes dormant in a vault. You can't do the same with the Mist.

> Now, Swain commands from the front lines, marching against a coming darkness that only he can seeâ€”in glimpses gathered by shadowy ravens from the corpses all around him. In a swirl of sacrifice and secrets, the greatest secret of all is that the true enemy lies within.

He know's something is coming, given his powers I think he'd be pretty well informed about things.

Literally every corpse his ravens can find is a source of information for him

Every victim of vel'koz, soul lost to the black mist, individual slain by the darkin, and person silenced by the black rose

He knows all the major threats.  But he also knows the other world leaders would not trust him and would likely refuse to unify with noxus on principle.  So the solution is to unify by force, make noxus as strong as possible to insure it survives what comes
